intro: Kleinia anteuphorbium, commonly known as the Cape gooseberry, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Aizoaceae family, commonly referred to as the ice plant family. The plant is characterized by its fleshy, succulent leaves and bright yellow-orange flowers that bloom in spring. It thrives in arid and semi-arid environments, often growing on rocky soils. The fruit, which resembles a small tomato, is edible and has a tart, sweet flavor.
